city.name: Lhasa
city.palaceDescr: The famous Tibetan palace and monastery, which was the residence of the Dalai Lama until 1959. The palace is situated on a hill and offers stunning views of the city. It houses treasures, Buddhist relics, and unique works of art.
city.templeDescr: One of the most sacred temples in Tibet, attracting pilgrims from around the world. The temple has a rich history and is known for its statue of Buddha, considered holy.
city.lakeDescr: Explore well-preserved sections of Nam Co Lake that once surrounded the city. It’s a great place for a walk and to gain insight into lhasa’s past.
city.museumDescr: A museum featuring exhibits on the history, culture, and art of Tibet. It’s a great place to get an overview of the region.
city.marketDescr: Explore local markets like the Choike Market to buy Tibetan jewelry, fabrics, tea, and other traditional items.
city.cultureDescr: Watch traditional Tibetan dances and musical performances to learn more about local culture and traditions.
